snippet: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel called on the international community “not to run to recognize” the new Palestinian government scheduled to be sworn in Monday, saying it rests on a terrorist organization.
abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu tries to dissuade international community from recognizing new Palestinian government scheduled to be sworn in, saying that it is closely tied with militant Islamic group Hamas.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Fares Akram contributed reporting from Gaza, Said Ghazali from Jerusalem, and Michael R. Gordon from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel called on the international community “not to run to recognize” the new Palestinian government scheduled to be sworn in Monday, saying it rests on a terrorist organization.

headline.main: Israel Warns Against Embracing Newly Reconciled Palestinian Government
headline.print_headline: Israel Warns Against Embracing Newly Reconciled Palestinian Government
